channel.title: Powershell on EUC365 | Modern Technology Blog

item.title: Create Dynamic Application Packages with PowerShell
item.description: Dynamic? In what way? When I say the packages are dynamic, I mean that you don’t have to update the application package when a new version is released by the vendor.

item.title: Deploy Windows Subsystem for Linux
item.description: What is the Windows Susbsystem for Linux? As per the Microsoft Documentation, The Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) is a new Windows 10 feature that enables you to run native Linux command-line tools directly on Windows, alongside your traditional Windows desktop and modern store apps.

item.title: Creating Intune Win32 Apps
item.description: Win32 Apps, What Are they? If you’re familiar with Configuration Manager/MEMCM then think of these files as your source directory, the difference being you are effectively zipping it up and then uploading to Intune.

item.title: Backup and Import App Protection Policies
item.description: Why backup App Protection Policies? Why would you need to back up something that runs in stored and hosted on Azure?

item.title: Add devices to an Azure Group using the Microsoft Graph API
item.description: Have you ever needed to add a device to an Azure AD Group as part of your MEMCM or Autopilot deployment for specific app, profiles or scripts?

item.title: Enrol Devices to Autopilot (Unattended)
item.description: I have been working on a project at the company I work for, and up to this point we have been primarily focused on getting new devices imported and deploying via Autopilot.
